# INImage

**Class**

Image data inside an Intents extension or Intents UI extension.

## Declaration

```swift
class INImage
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INImage] is a wrapper for image data that you include in a response to an intent. When providing a response to an intent, you must specify any image parameters using instances of this class. [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INImage] supports the same formats as the underlying platform.

When confirming or handling an intent, you provide a response object with details about how your app handles that intent. When that response contains an image, use the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INImage/imageSize(for:)] method to determine the required image size and then create an instance of this class with the corresponding image data.

## Creating an Image Object

- **init(named:)**: Creates an image object from an image file in the extension’s bundle.
- **init(UIImage:)**: Creates an image object from the specified UIKit image.
- **init(CGImage:)**: Creates an image object from the specified Core Graphics image.
- **init(imageData:)**: Creates an image object from the specified data.
- **init(url:)**: Creates an image object from an image file in the local file system.
- **init(url:width:height:)**: Creates an image object, of the specified size, from an image file in the local file system.

## Getting the Image

- **fetchUIImage(completion:)**: Fetches the image and provides it to the specified completion handler.

## Getting the Preferred Image Size

- **imageSize(for:)**: Returns the preferred image size for the specified response object.

## Getting a System Symbol Image

- **systemImageNamed(_:)**: Returns an image object that contains the specified system symbol image.

## Initializers

- **init(NSImage:)**

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
